A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Disappointed\, underwhelmed. Never in a million years would I have believed anyone who told me I would not cry buckets at Luke Skywalker becoming one with the force. Yet it happened in this travesty of a Star Wars film\, and I didn't shed a tear. Not because of Mark Hamill's performance - he was superb. Not even because they killed off Luke - I was prepared for that\, and somewhat reconciled with the fact they were gonna do it\, because no one involved in the sorry mess that is Disney-Lucasfilm has a clue what to do with such a quality character apparently.
Anyways\, long story short. I liked -
The "performances" of Mark Hamill\,  Adam Driver\, Carrie Fisher\, Laura Dern. Everyone else ranged from mediocre to rubbish.
I disliked -
The whole Canto Bight plot
The juvenile\, forced humour
Awful CGI
The fight sequences - all of them
Too many new characters I really could not care less about.
I reeeally disliked -
Superman Leia
Moof-milking Luke
........oh Lord\, you know what? forget it. I could go on all day and it's like reliving a bad dream just thinking about it.
I'll just say this film felt like a Harry Pottter meets Marvel (at it's worst) meets Transformers meets Spaceballs meets West Side Story (those light sabre "fights" geez!!!) -meets Battlestar Galactica. In fact\, it felt like anything BUT a Star Wars film. Thank you Rian Johnson\, Disney and Lucasfilm for making this the first Star Wars film I will only ever see once. You are not getting one more penny out of me for this rubbish.
